[[type:tools]]

# Urbanist ai

![](data:image/png;base64,)

## Overview
Urbanist AI is a generative AI platform for participatory planning and co-design of urban places that integrates multiple generative AI technologies.

## Purpose
The purpose of using Urbanist AI is to harness the power of collective intelligence, democratize urban change, and enable stakeholders to participate in the co-design process of their cities.

## How it works
Urbanist AI uses generative AI technologies to enable participants to co-create and design urban places. It can be used for participatory planning and co-design exercises, allowing stakeholders to engage with the tool and contribute to the design process.

## Requirements
No specific pre-requirements are needed to use Urbanist AI, but it is recommended that facilitators get acquainted with the tool before commencing a workshop. The tool can be used in various settings, including workshops and collaborative co-creation exercises.

## Reflections
When using Urbanist AI for R&D purposes, it's essential to keep in mind its potential for localization of problems and to consider how to extend its benefits beyond collaborative co-creation exercises. Additionally, the tool should be used in conjunction with other aspects of the portfolio process.

## Related methods (if any)
Urbanist AI is related to Community Asset Mapping, Citizen Science, Co-creation, Design Sprints, and Participatory Design.

## License
Urbanist AI is available under a free or open license.

## Examples
The tool has been used in various settings, including workshops and collaborative co-creation exercises. For example, it was used by the UNDP to facilitate participatory design workshops and enable stakeholders to engage with the tool and contribute to the design process.
